intro: Morettia canescens var. microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved morettia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, pale pink to white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or along stream banks. It has a compact growth habit and is often found in humid tropical climates. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
